item.title: Sources: UzReport
item.description: Launched in 1999, UzReport is one of the largest news portals in Uzbekistan. It offers coverage of politics, economics, culture, and sports, as well as analytical and interview pieces.

item.title: Sources: Oydin Nur
item.description: Founded in 1999, Regional Center for Social Protection of the Family “Oydin Nur” is a shelter in the the Bukhara Region of Uzbekistan that offers long term shelter to female victims of gender-based violence, as well as legal and medical services and resources for personal development. The center organizes seminars and trainings concerning issues of women in the country. State departments of internal affairs, education, and health are listed as partners of Oydin Nur.

item.title: Sources: Eurasianet
item.description: Founded in 1999 and based at Columbia University’s Harriman Institute, Eurasianet.org offers coverage of current events in Central Asia and South Caucasus.

item.title: Sources: PONARS Eurasia
item.description: Founded in the late 1990s and currently based at the George Washington University’s Institute for European, Russian, and Eurasian Studies (IERES), the Program on New Approaches to Research and Security in Eurasia (PONARS Eurasia) offers policy analysis and dialogue. The program aims to advance new approaches in research on security, politics, economics, and society in Russia and Eurasia.

item.title: Sources: Zakon.kz
item.description: Founded in 1999, Zakon.kz offers news coverage of current events in Kazakhstan, Central Asia, Russia, and the US, as well as analytical materials and interviews.
